title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Several spells of showers may occur in the Central, Uva and Eastern provinces and in the Polonnaruwa and Mullaitivu districts today, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Libya’s top military chief killed in plane crash in Turkey
byline: The head of Libya’s armed forces and four other high-ranking military officials died late on Tuesday (Dec 23) when their business jet crashed shortly after taking off from Ankara, officials in Türkiye’s capital and Tripoli said.

title: Gold prices hit record high of over US$ 4,500 per ounce
byline: Gold rose to a record above US$ 4,500 an ounce on escalating tensions in Venezuela and expectations for more US rate cuts. Silver and platinum also advanced to all-time peaks.

title: T-56 firearm and ammunition recovered from car abandoned in Ragama
byline: A T-56 firearm and two magazines with ammunition recovered from a car abandoned at Pahalawatte in Ragama, Police stated.

title: Trains from Colombo to Kankesanthurai and Batticaloa to resume today
byline: The Northern Railway Line will be fully reopened for train operations from today (24), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: Special security and traffic plan in Colombo
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced a special traffic plan to minimize congestion in Colombo.

title: Crisis in India-Bangladesh relations spirals amid violent protests
byline: The killing of a man from a minority community during recent violent protests in Bangladesh has pushed already strained ties between Dhaka and Delhi into a deeper crisis.

title: ‘Kush’ narcotics worth over Rs. 60M found inside package at Central Mail Exchange
byline: A stock of ‘Kush’ narcotics worth over Rs. 60 million has been found inside a package sent to Sri Lanka from Thailand.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka increase by another Rs. 2,000
byline: Gold rates in the local market continue to rise with the rapid increase in prices in the global market.

title: Fishing vessel taken into custody with narcotics in southern seas brought to Dikkowita Harbour
byline: A multi-day fishing vessel taken into custody by the Sri Lanka Navy along with narcotics in southern seas has been brought to the Dikkowita Fisheries Harbour.

title: India successfully launches US BlueBird Block-2 satellite on LVM3 in commercial mission
byline: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) successfully launched the LVM3-M6 mission today, December 24, delivering the BlueBird Block-2 satellite into orbit.

title: 374,000 workers affected by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka, ILO estimates
byline: Around 374,000 workers in Sri Lanka have been affected by Cyclone Ditwah, according to a research conducted by the International Labour Organization.

title: Special train service in place for Christmas and school holidays
byline: The Department of Railways has decided to operate additional train journeys in view of the Christmas season, school holidays, and the year-end long weekend.

title: Inaugural flight from Poland to Sri Lanka for winter season lands at BIA
byline: The inaugural flight from Poland to Sri Lanka for the winter season landed at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), last night (23).

title: US denies visas to ex-EU commissioner and others over social media rules
byline: The US State Department said it would deny visas to five people, including a former EU commissioner, for seeking to “coerce” American social media platforms into suppressing viewpoints they oppose.

title: US judge rejects business group’s challenge to Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee
byline: A federal judge on Tuesday rejected a challenge by the largest U.S. business lobby group to President Donald Trump’s $100,000 fee on new H-1B visas for highly skilled foreign workers, saying it fell under his broad powers to regulate immigration.

title: Detention order issued on Sampath Manamperi extended
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who is currently in the custody of the Police Western Province North Crimes Division over allegations of concealing two containers of raw materials allegedly used in the production of the drug crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) and possession of weapons, was produced before the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today (24).

title: Samsung Electronics to unveil world’s first 6K gaming monitor at CES 2026
byline: Samsung Electronics will unveil five new gaming monitor models at CES 2026, to be held in Las Vegas on Jan. 4 (local time) next year, including the world’s first gaming monitor to support 6K ultra-high resolution.

title: Restoration work on landslide-hit Sri Pada-Hatton Road nears completion
byline: Restoration work on the Sri Pada-Hatton road, which was damaged by a landslide in Mahagiri Damba, is currently in its final stages.

title: 21kg of heroin and 172kg of ICE found on vessel taken into custody in southern seas
byline: A total of 21kg of heroin and 172kg crystal methamphetamine have been found in the multi-day fishing vessel which was taken into custody in southern seas by the Sri Lanka Navy yesterday (23).

title: Western province accounts for 42% of country’s nominal GDP: CBSL
byline: The Western province continued to account for the largest share of the country’s nominal GDP, representing a share of 42.4 per cent in 2024, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: NBRO warns landslide risk persists in several areas despite lifting of red alerts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has cautioned that although landslide red alerts have been lifted, the risk in the affected areas has not yet fully subsided.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna surrenders to police
byline: The Jaffna District Member of Parliament Ramanathan Archchuna has been arrested after surrendering to the Colombo Fort Police.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna granted bail
byline: Jaffna District Member of Parliament Ramanathan Archchuna, who was arrested this morning after surrendering to the Colombo Fort Police, has been granted bail.

title: Russia plans a nuclear power plant on the moon within a decade
byline: Russia plans to put a nuclear power plant on the moon in the next decade to supply its lunar space programme and a joint Russian-Chinese research station as major powers rush to explore the earth’s only natural satellite.

title: Underworld figure Kudu Roshan arrested
byline: Notorious underworld figure “Kudu Roshan” has been arrested.

title: Suspects arrested for setting fire to wild elephant in Mihintale further remanded
byline: Three individuals arrested in relation to the alleged torture and setting fire to a wild elephant in Sippukulama, Mihintale have been further remanded.

title: Showers expected in several provinces tomorrow
byline: A few showers have been predicted in the Uva province and in Ampara, Batticaloa, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts for tomorrow (25).

title: Public urged to exercise caution when using unknown water bodies during festive season
byline: The general public has been urged to exercise caution when using unknown water bodies during the festive season.

title: PM assures action to restore and relocate schools affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the Ministry of Education, together with UNICEF, will take necessary steps to renovate schools that can be restored quickly and to relocate schools located in high-risk areas to safer locations, following an assessment of schools affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Suspect who stole foreign currency from tourist hotel arrested within 12 hours
byline: The Tourist Police in Unawatuna have arrested a suspect in connection with the theft of USD 500 in foreign currency from a tourist hotel in the Unawatuna area.

title: Southeastern Taiwan shaken by 6.1 magnitude quake, no immediate reports of damage
byline: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.1 struck Taiwan’s southeastern coastal county of Taitung on Wednesday, the island’s weather administration said, although there were no immediate reports of damage.

title: Opposition calls revote on Galle MC’s budget after mayor leaves
byline: An opposition member of the Galle Municipal Council occupied the Mayor’s seat and called for a revote today (24) on the council’s annual budget, following a tense situation inside the council chamber.

title: Constable injured after accidental discharge of firearm at police station
byline: A police constable was injured and admitted to hospital after a firearm was accidentally discharged inside the Ambalangoda Police Station this evening (24), police said.

title: Sri Lankan man arrested after knife incident near Tokyo’s Shinagawa Station
byline: A Sri Lankan national was arrested on Monday, 22nd December, after pressing a utility knife to his neck outside a Yoshinoya restaurant near Shinagawa Station in Minato-ku, Tokyo.

title: 68% of Badulla District identified as landslide-risk areas: NBRO
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has stated that nearly 68% of the total land area in the Badulla District is at varying levels of landslide risk.

title: Zelensky reveals US-Ukraine plan to end Russian war, key questions remain
byline: The 20-point plan, agreed on by US and Ukrainian negotiators, was being reviewed by Moscow, but the Kremlin is unlikely to abandon its hardline territorial demands for full Ukrainian withdrawal from the east.
